results.title: Svadebka
results.creator_credit: RM Arts, Nederlandse Omroep Stichting and Hans Hulsher
results.brief_description: A studio recording of the renowned Netherlands Dance Theatre’s interpretation of Stravinsky’s Les Noces (Svadebka). Choreographed by Jiri Kylian, the piece pictures the ceremony of a traditonal Russian country wedding through a fusion of ballet with some contemporary influences. The dance engages with the rapid pace and intricate rhythms of Stravinsky’s score in a spirited evocation of the mystery of marriage, both its beauty and apprehension, particularly for the bride to be.

results.title: Suzi's story
results.creator_credit: Carlyon-Gillespie Production, Pro-image and Iain E. Gillespie
results.brief_description: This is the true story of the Lovegrove family. It is the story of Suzi, a loving wife and mother stricken with AIDS. This documentary poignantly deals with this tragic and deadly virus, and seeks to educate the viewer about the debilitating effects of AIDS not only on the victim, but on those who love her. This film sensitively brings home the reality of AIDS. It won’t easily be forgotten.

results.title: Suzhou River = Su Zhou He [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dream Factory, Essential Film, Nai An, Philippe Bober and Lou Ye
results.brief_description: The Suzhou River is the backdrop to this haunting tale of obsessive love and mystery set in the not so illustrious part of modern day Shanghai. Told through the eyes and words of a freelance videographer, we follow Mardar (Jia Hongsheng) a motor-cycle courier in his mid-twenties who does his pick-ups and deliveries, no questions asked. However, when Mardar finds himself delivering Moudan (Zhou Xun), the 16 year-old daughter of an alcoholic smuggler, to her aunt, he has no idea what is in store for him. A tender loving relationship soon forms between the two only to be put to the test when Mardar is persuaded by his shady associates to kidnap Moudan and hold her to ransom. Moudan, heartbroken and betrayed, makes her escape vowing to Mardar before jumping off the bridge into the murky depths of the Suzhou River, that she will come back as a mermaid to haunt him. Accused of Moudan’s murder, Mardar spends a few years in prison until his release, when grief-stricken and distraught, he sets out to find his beloved Moudan. When he encounters Meimei (Zhou Xun), a nightclub dancer who performs in an aquarium as a mermaid and who bears a striking resemblance to Moudan, Mardar becomes totally obsessed in the belief that Meimei is his lost love, Moudan. Intricate, mesmerising and visually stunning, Lou Ye pays homage to Hitchcock’s “Vertigo” and Wong Kar Wai’s “Chungking Express” in his treatment of this compelling multi award-winning film. Cinematography by Wang Yu and original music by Jorg Lemberg. (Awards: Paris; Fantasporto; Rotterdam; Viennale)

results.title: Suture
results.creator_credit: Kino-Korsakoff, Scott McGehee and David Siegel
results.brief_description: Clay is briefly re-acquainted with his half-brother Vincent at their father’s funeral. Vincent, wanting to flee the country, stages an accident meant to look like his own death, but substitutes Clay in his place. Remarkable, Clay survives the explosion, although he now suffers amnesia. With the help of a plastic surgeon and a psychoanalyst, he is ‘restored’ to an identity that was never his, Vincent’s. As Clay, now Vincent, begins to enjoy a new lease on life and new identity, he realises that he is suspected of murder. What may seem like a standard thriller is given a subversive spin by having Clay played by a black actor and Vincent by a white actor and having no-one during the course of the film commenting on it. The film explores the concept of personal and racial identity as well as that of social construct with a great sense of irony. Stephen Soderbergh was the film’s executive producer. Cast includes Dennis Haysbert, Michael Harris, Mel Harris, Sab Shimono and Dina Merrill.

results.title: Susso kids
results.brief_description: Crops might just as well be ploughed into the ground or left to rot in the sun! From Black Thursday, October 1929, Australian productivity had never been higher, but there was no market for it. This documentary depicts causes and effects of the Great Depression in Australia, using film clips of the period. Shows the divisive effect of the disparity in living conditions, attempts by the unemployed to improve their social and economic circumstances and the plight of the children. Linked by songs of the period. Commentary by Telford Jackson.

results.title: Suspiria [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: La Seda, Claudio Argento and Dario Argento
results.brief_description: Presented in widescreen, this un-cut version of Dario Argento’s ‘Suspiria’ is the first part (1980’s ‘Inferno’ being the follow up) in an as yet to be complete trilogy called “The Three mothers”. Susy Banyon (Jessica Harper), an American Ballet student travels to Germany to attend the exclusive Tanz Academy in Frieburg. Legend goes that the ancient school was once the residence of a witches coven, headed by an evil and powerful black witch named Mater Suspiriorum (Black Widow). When a series of grisly murders begin to occur at the ballet school, Susy begins to suspect that witchcraft may be involved. Working at the height of his creative powers (following the box office success of 1975’s ‘Deep Red’) Argento raises the level of terror with his trademark blood soaked set pieces by using vibrant colour film stock, abrupt editing, multi-layered sound scapes (including the techno-rock Goblin score) and rapid camera movement. Cast also includes Alida Valli, Udo Kier, Stefania Casini, Joan Bennett, Flavio Bucci, Miguel Bose, Barbara Magnolfi and Susanna Javicoli.

results.title: Suspicion
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A dowdy and repressed young woman, a colonel’s daughter who has led a sheltered life, is irresistibly attracted to a man who is romantic and reckless, a rejection of everything her family background and upbringing have stood for. After their marriage she finds that he is a liar and, she suspects, a murderer. She comes to believe that he plans to murder her. Although the ending is apparently not what Hitchcock originally intended, the film as it now stands does not run counter to his interest in the themes of paranoia and the fragility of relationships. Cast includes Cary Grant, Joan Fontaine, Sir Cedric Hardwicke, Nigel Bruce and Dame May Whitty. Adapted from the novel ‘Before the Fact’ by Francis Iles.
